paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant R531W, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and functional studies.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Of the edited KCNH2R531W hiPSC clones, clone 4 was used for all further experiments.
1 of 12 viable clones had the target heterozygous edit (deemed clone 4), while 2 of 17 viable clones had the target heterozygous edit in the second round (deemed clones 2 and 9).
1 of 12 viable clones had the target heterozygous edit (deemed clone 4), while 2 of 17 viable clones had the target heterozygous edit in the second round (deemed clones 2 and 9).

functional_data.summary: The R531W mutation in KCNH2 leads to a significant decrease in IKr current density, indicating a detrimental effect on hERG function.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the edited hiPSC lines.
variants.additional_notes: The study utilized CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing to create the R531W mutation in KCNH2.
key_quotes: R531 is among these important amino acids within the VSD and has been suggested to have a number of functions, including gating charge movement and inactivation.
Edited hiPSC-CM IKr current density was found to be significantly decreased, indicative that the impact of R531W mutation is detrimental to hERG function.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant R531W was successfully extracted.
